lexUnit.name: cost.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: require the payment of (a specified sum) in order to be bought or obtained.

sentence.text: The revamped car will cost £40,268 when it goes on sale next January .
This auto tractor cost eleven hundred pounds when it was first built in 1940 .
It would cost a fortune to see the work of the great masters spread around the art galleries of the World .
It costs a lot of money to upkeep sufficient staff to take care of the pictures .
The Albert Dock cost almost £300,000 to construct and measures 335 metres in length by 137 metres in width .
A cassette costs forty pence to make and a CD about Ninety .
